16 October 2008

2009 African Private Sector Forum - "Advancing Sustainability and Business Competitiveness in Africa", 22-23 January, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia

Jointly organized by the African Union, the International Trade Council and the UN Global Compact, the Forum will bring business and financial leaders from all regions of the world together with their African peers and public policy makers.    

A select group of GC participants with interests in the African region will shortly receive a SAVE THE DATE letter from Georg Kell inviting them to mark their calendars for the event.

For further information contact Cecilie Hultmann at hultmann@un.org

Global Compact Monthly Update to Participants

Starting in November, the Global Compact Office will send a monthly update from the Global Compact Office directly to all participants detailing upcoming events, activities and opportunities for engagement. The monthly update will be sent in the first week of each month.

HUMAN RIGHTS

International Seminar on Business and Human Rights 4-5 December 2008 The Business and Human Rights International Seminar will take place on 4 & 5 December 2008, in Paris, France to celebrate the 60th Anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.    

Human Rights breakfast for CEOs In conjunction with the International Seminar, there will also be a CEO Breakfast on 4 December, an exclusive, invitation-only event for business leaders and senior representatives of civil society organizations, trade unions, academia, governments and international organizations, co-hosted by Mary Robinson and the UN Global Compact. Further information about the breakfast can be obtained from the Global Compact Office.

For additional about the International Seminar please contact Charis Desinioti at info@anniversaryseminar.org or +33 158 07 77 10.

LABOUR

Global Compact Labour Working Group to meet in New York The second meeting of the Global Compact Labour Working Group will convene at the UN Headquarters in New York on the morning of December 16.    

Global Compact participants are welcome to share their dilemmas or concerns about specific labour principles such as freedom of association and collective bargaining. Based on their response, the Labour Working Group can include these items in the meeting's agenda.

Local Networks are also encouraged to inform participants that the Labour Working Group was established under the auspices of the Global Compact Board. Participant companies interested in becoming a member of the working group, or having a representative attend the meeting in New York may contact Ursula Wynhoven at wynhoven@un.org or Venu Keesari at keesari@unglobalcompact.org

ASIA

Responsible Business Global Forum 2009, 15-16 January, Delhi, India

UNIDO Workshop on "Responsible Micro, Small and Medium Sized Enterprise (MSMEs)

For more details on each    

Co-hosted by the UN Global Compact and organized by Global Initiatives, the Responsible Business Global Forum will focus on "Leading change - Advancing the environmental, social and governance agenda" at the Taj Palace Hotel, Delhi.

CEOs and senior executives attending will join leaders from government, NGOs and other international organizations to explore solutions for a better future. A select group of GC participants with interests in the region will shortly receive an invitation for the event.

For further information please contact Melissa Powell at powell1@un.org

UNIDO India is convening a Workshop on "Responsible Micro, Small and Medium Sized Enterprise (MSMEs) Clusters" on November 19, 2008 at Hotel Qutab, New Delhi, India. They would like to extend an invitation to all interested Global Compact Local Network Focal Points and participants from the region. Please find the background note and the tentative agenda.

For further information on the event please contact Mr. Namit Mutreja, UNIDO India at namitmutreja@gmail.com

MIDDLE EAST

Second International Business Forum on Financing for Development - 28 November 2008 On behalf of the United Nations Business Steering Committee on Financing for Development, the UN Global Compact Office will invite GC participants from the Middle East to attend the Second International Business Forum on Financing for Development "The Impact of the Financial Crisis & Proposed Roadmaps: Mobilizing Private Sector Resources for Development" on 28 November 2008 and the official meetings of the United Nations Follow-up Conference on Financing for Development, 29 November to 2 December in Doha, Qatar.

For more information, please contact Ms. Lea Felluss at lea.felluss@iccwbo.org or phone 1-212-703-5044.
